channel.title: Private servers dont work with windows 7?
channel.description: well im trying to download/make servers on this computer, I have the latest version of JDK installed Java, ETC. Changed the Paths in compiler and all that crap, still get Path cannot be specified, or Cannot find Javaw Javac, etc... Just wonderin if anyone could help?

item.title: Private servers dont work with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

Arkathol:

I have it now, i had to get it out of Program Files (x86) Works good now, thanks for your help guys.

No problem

item.title: Private servers dont work with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Arkathol Arkathol
item.description:
@Arkathol wrote:

Okay thankss, I put that in, and it says i dont have java installed and took me to the site… But ive tried installing it like 3 times, And what ive noticed in windows 7, it puts programs in Program Files (86x) instead of Regular Program Files, would that have anything to do with it?

Read full topic
item.source: Private servers dont work with windows 7?

item.title: Private servers dont work with windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

You may have a bad compiler, replace it with

SOURCE COMPILER:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
